Two users reused a prime when generating their RSA keys. Recover the message: 247728592298445842132457911285670379029627536209029545976391991575029041277415148118440417176857770846897859482179478081411608240660991696328497145880308817038215065335326910733980964271422344253303667596757209106120806997172089166

n=680321524635293870759367220040912882079075457171034462790172907100781500991479621349153782411435562477199171798116194906896387607628822783523214603583975270470594106261274654750065871187351974693322212904672812408743832747238547283, n2=828156983146934723612325615152696022181173477958010804958790290368874103945037903703606368228755895281536895155190536083565206975541877016318356428940304071528842944548135957332064709383219724149497509814466261968132902220453140879, e=422912335754150913234959489568889145363693838909393006742444135305307817959680718818721397616270406520344062759641182382983274311656929671510211302110650434402388505503499732122611224034814708030695157541095304856572691414702081097

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{qqsfwjy4}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 247728592298445842132457911285670379029627536209029545976391991575029041277415148118440417176857770846897859482179478081411608240660991696328497145880308817038215065335326910733980964271422344253303667596757209106120806997172089166
vulnerability: shared prime
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common prime, computing GCD(n, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
